Im not black, but a person of color and I just want to say how fucking proud I am of black people and the way they were treated and to come out like this as big artists, actors and actresses, doctors, engineers, loving people,  is just crazy. I hope, especially after this movie, that we can start acknowledging  different cultures and skin colors (for those who were stripped away from theirs) and respect them... Is just such a beautifull and crazy thought... I love you all. Stay strong, because it gets better. Look at the hard work of your ancestors and how their hard work paid off for their children and grandchildren and the generations after that and imagine if they gave up.  They didnt. Just hold on. Stay strong.

Ok call me crazy but I have a theory on Kendrick's pirate look. I was so confused as to why he was dressed like a pirate in two of the scenes in the video so I googled the word pirate and this is the definition it gave me "Piracy is an act of robbery or criminal violence by ship or boat-borne attackers upon another ship or a coastal area, typically with the goal of stealing cargo and other valuable items or properties. Those who engage in acts of piracy are called pirates. " So after reading this, I deduced that the colonials were the original pirates when they arrived on the African coastal areas and took precious cargo (people)  in order to exploit them abroad for self-gain. In the starting scene, Kendrick arrives in a boat guided by the ancestors who were thrown overboard. I think this is symbolizing him being a pirate and stealing back the ship his ancestors were taken on and returning it back to the motherland ie: the end scene where he is dressed as a pirate standing in front of the 4 tall women. Am I reaching or am I on to something?
